इति शुश्रुम धीराणां ये नस्तद्विचचक्षिरे ॥ १३ ॥

translations.text: Different indeed, they say, is the result from sambhava (meditation on Hiraṇyagarbha); different, they say, is the result from asambhava (meditation on Prakṛti). Thus have we heard from the wise who explained that to us.
Different, indeed, they say, is (the result) from sambhūti; and different, they say, is (the result) from asambhūti. Thus have we heard from the wise who explained it to us.

bhashya.sanskrit:
अन्यदेव पृथगेव आहुः फलं सम्भवात् सम्भूतेः कार्यब्रह्मोपासनात् अणिमाद्यैश्वर्यलक्षणम् आख्यातवन्त इत्यर्थः । तथा च अन्यदाहुरसम्भवात् असम्भूतेः अव्याकृतात् अव्याकृतोपासनात् यदुक्तम् 'अन्धं तमः प्रविशन्ति' (ई. उ. ९) इति, प्रकृतिलय इति च पौराणिकैरुच्यते । इति एवं शुश्रुम धीराणां वचनं ये नस्तद्विचचक्षिरे व्याकृताव्याकृतोपासनफलं व्याख्यातवन्त इत्यर्थः ॥ 

यत एवम् , अतः समुच्चयः सम्भूत्यसम्भूत्युपासनयोर्युक्तः एकैकपुरुषार्थत्वाच्चेत्याह —
keyPoints: Different result from sambhava (sambhūti) - meditation on kārya-brahman (Hiraṇyagarbha)
Result from Hiraṇyagarbha meditation: aṇimā and other supernatural powers (aiśvarya)
Different result from asambhava (asambhūti) - meditation on avyākṛta (Prakṛti)
Result from Prakṛti meditation: prakṛti-laya (dissolution into Prakṛti)
This prakṛti-laya is mentioned by Paurāṇikas (Purāṇic authorities)
Reference to 'entering blind darkness' from verse 9 for Prakṛti meditation
Teaching received from the wise (dhīra) who explained fruits of vyākṛta and avyākṛta upāsanās
Establishes distinct results justifying combination of both meditations
bhashya.notes: This mantra parallels verse 10, establishing that sambhūti meditation (on manifest Hiraṇyagarbha) and asambhūti meditation (on unmanifest Prakṛti) have different results. Śaṅkara Bhagavadpāda specifies that Hiraṇyagarbha upāsanā yields aṇimā and other yogic powers (the eight aiśvaryas), while Prakṛti upāsanā leads to prakṛti-laya - dissolution into material nature. The latter is the 'blind darkness' mentioned earlier and is described in the Purāṇas. Since both have distinct valid results, both should be combined by qualified seekers, not practiced exclusively. This verse provides scriptural authority for the combination (samuccaya) teaching.

centralTeaching: Meditation on sambhūti (Hiraṇyagarbha) and asambhūti (Prakṛti) yield different results according to the wise teachers. Hiraṇyagarbha meditation gives supernatural powers, while Prakṛti meditation leads to dissolution in Prakṛti. This difference in fruits justifies their combination.

coreConcepts.definition: The eight supernatural powers beginning with aṇimā (ability to become atomic); yogic siddhis attained through Hiraṇyagarbha upāsanā
Supernatural powers, lordship; the yogic powers like aṇimā (minuteness), mahimā (expansion), etc.
Dissolution into Prakṛti; merging with material nature, mentioned in Purāṇas as result of Prakṛti meditation
Effect Brahman; Hiraṇyagarbha, the cosmic being who is the effect/manifestation, not supreme Brahman
Authorities of the Purāṇas; those versed in Purāṇic literature who describe prakṛti-laya
